Class SmsServiceImpl

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
SmsService
public class SmsServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements SmsService

This API allows for easy implementation of SMS services in an existing or new Sakai tool.

Author:
etienne@psybergate.co.za

getPreliminaryTask

public org.sakaiproject.sms.hibernate.model.SmsTask getPreliminaryTask(java.lang.String sakaiGroupId,
                                                                       java.util.Date dateToSend,
                                                                       java.lang.String messageBody,
                                                                       java.lang.String sakaiSiteId,
                                                                       java.lang.String sakaiToolId,
                                                                       java.lang.String sakaiSenderID)
Get a new task with default attributes. The task is only a object. It is not yet persisted to the database. For eg. send message y to Sakai group X at time Z. If the task is future dated, then it be picked up by the sms task (job) scheduler for processing.

Specified by:
getPreliminaryTask in interface SmsService
Parameters:
sakaiGroupId -
dateToSend -
messageBody -
sakaiToolId -
Returns:

Add a new task to the sms task list. In this case you must supply a list of Sakai user ID's.

checkSufficientCredits

public boolean checkSufficientCredits(java.lang.String sakaiSiteID,
                                      java.lang.String sakaiUserID,
                                      int creditsRequired)
Return true of the account has the required credits available to send the messages. The account number is calculated using either the Sakai site or the Sakai user. If this returns false, then the UI must not allow the user to proceed. If not handled by the UI, then the sms service will fail the sending of the message anyway.

Specified by:
checkSufficientCredits in interface SmsService
Parameters:
sakaiSiteID - , (e.g. "!admin")
sakaiUserID - the sakai user id
creditsRequired - the credits required
Returns:
true, if check sufficient credits

checkSufficientCredits

public boolean checkSufficientCredits(org.sakaiproject.sms.hibernate.model.SmsTask smsTask)
Return true of the account has the required credits available to send the messages. The account number is calculated using either the Sakai site or the Sakai user. If this returns false, then the UI must not allow the user to proceed. If not handled by the UI, then the sms service will fail the sending of the message anyway.

Specified by:
checkSufficientCredits in interface SmsService
Returns:
